entry.def: If you accuse someone of obduracy, you think their refusal to change their decision or opinion is unreasonable.

example.ex: MPs have accused the government of obduracy and called on ministers to reverse their decision.
example.tran: 议员指责政府顽固不化，呼吁部长们改变决定。

means.word_mean: 1. resoluteness by virtue of being unyielding and inflexible

auth_sentence.content: But in the end too many mistakes and the sheer obduracy of the visitors meant a narrow victory was all Saints could chisel out.
auth_sentence.res_content: But in the end too many mistakes and the sheer obduracy of the visitors meant a narrow victory was all Saints could chisel out.

auth_sentence.content: But this stylistic obduracy was, for Bernhard, both a necessity and a source of glee.
